Body:
for my schoolproject i tried to communicate from my raspberry with Windows iot to a pc over TCP- sockets. All works fine but i want to log the traffic an also realise if something goes wrong.

So I programmed this LogFilewriter:

 public static void write(string message)	    {           		            using (StreamWriter w = File.AppendText(\\" + "log.txt"))	            {	                logging(message
column9: w);	            }		    }	    public static void logging(string logMessage
column13:
logMessage); w.WriteLine("-------------------------------"); }

The Problem is that if i call Log.write(message) - (Log is the class) it throws following Exception:

Blockquote Exception thrown: 'System.UnauthorizedAccessException' in System.IO.FileSystem.dll

Has somebody an idea why this exception is thrown?

"

Body: Where (on which path) does your logging" exe run?"
TextWriter is used in other parts of the class? Why you don't use an existing log?

I have to split it because this is for comercial use later on - an user should be able to read de specific log then.                                                                 However I tried to go to this path because i thought of this is unprotected....but it isn't :      `using (StreamWriter w = File.AppendText(c$\\Users\\Public\\log.txt"))	                {	                    logging(message
Running in the standard debug folder from Visual Studio on the Pi.
Why did you write \\log.txt? Just write "log.txt" and the log file should appear in the same folder of the .exe file?"

Streamwriter with true, will append the content to file

    using (StreamWriter w = new StreamWriter(\\" + "log.txt"
I tried that but it doesn't work - can't convert String into IOStream.
hmm, leme try again - It was pseudo. Will fire up my IoT when I reach my workshop
Thank you - i can't get this work ....always this Unauthorized Access Exception....

Isn't it the same as normal windows? You cannot write into the same folder as your EXE because permissions doesn't allow it. Either that or it is because the app is sandboxed.

I think this explains it?

https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/67e9d61c-ccb6-47e4-8c7a-968166701920/c-write-to-file-on-windows-10-iot?forum=WindowsIoT

It says this
column9: I think you're supposed to work with StorageFile and StorageFolder for UWP applications. We used them and had no issues so far. When I tried to work with the File class in the first release
column10:
it wasn't available at all.

Maybe this changed now. Try saving the file in your file in the "C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Local\Packages\YOURPACKAGE". The application should have access there and maybe you can use the File class then.

Read the whole thing because it also mentions that the file IO is sandboxed
column11: and provides this link to suggest how to write to a file
